words.definition: If something is alongside another thing, then it is next to it.
words.example: We work alongside each other in the office.

words.definition: Your appetite is your hunger for food.
words.example: Tom has a big appetite. He eats all the time.

words.definition: To assist someone is to help them.
words.example: Andrew assisted me with my homework.

words.definition: A breeze is a soft wind.
words.example: The breeze caused the leaves to fall off the tree.

words.definition: To defy someone is to work against them or refuse to do what they say.
words.example: The child defied his parents and stayed out late.

words.definition: To display something means to show it to people.
words.example: The museum displays many ancient artifacts.

words.definition: If something is efficient, it works well without wasting time or energy.
words.example: This new car is very fuel-efficient.

words.definition: If someone is feeble, they are very weak.
words.example: The old man was too feeble to walk alone.

words.definition: To forgive someone means to stop being angry with them.
words.example: I forgave him for what he said.

words.definition: If someone is lively, they have a lot of energy.
words.example: She is a very lively person.

words.definition: If something is majestic, it is very beautiful and impressive.
words.example: The mountain was a majestic sight.

words.definition: You use nor to connect two negative ideas.
words.example: He neither ate nor slept.

words.definition: If you are outraged, you are very angry.
words.example: The public was outraged by the new tax laws.

words.definition: If you are pessimistic, you think bad things will happen.
words.example: He is very pessimistic about the future.

words.definition: A rumor is a story that may or may not be true.
words.example: I heard a rumor that he is leaving the company.

words.definition: To slap someone means to hit them with the open hand.
words.example: She slapped him in the face.

words.definition: To smash something means to break it into many pieces.
words.example: The window smashed when the ball hit it.

words.definition: To subject someone to something means to make them experience it.
words.example: They were subjected to many hardships.

words.definition: A wage is the money that a person is paid for their work.
words.example: He earns a good wage.

words.definition: You use whereas to show a contrast between two things.
words.example: He likes sports, whereas I prefer reading.
